glsa.title: Minitube: Insecure temporary file usage
glsa.synopsis: An insecure temporary file usage has been reported in Minitube, possibly allowing symlink attacks.

background.p: Minitube is a Qt4 YouTube desktop client.

description.p: Tomáš Pružina reported that Minitube does not handle temporary files securely.

impact.p: A local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Minitube users should upgrade to the latest version:
NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are available since November 11, 2011. It is likely that your system is already no longer affected by this issue.
